title: tools/cmd/gorename, tools/refactor/rename: package documentation is outdated
body:
The [refactor/rename package docs](http://godoc.org/golang.org/x/tools/refactor/rename) read:

> Package rename contains the implementation of the 'gorename' command whose main function is in golang.org/x/tools/refactor/rename. See that package for the command documentation.

This *is* the `golang.org/x/tools/refactor/rename` package...but it's not a command.


The [cmd/gorename package docs](http://godoc.org/golang.org/x/tools/cmd/gorename) read:

> The gorename command performs precise type-safe renaming of identifiers in Go source code. See the -help message or Usage constant for details.

But there is no Usage constant.


Seems like the docs got a bit muddled during the library-vs-command split. :P I'd fix it, but I'm not quite sure what the intended organization is.

/cc @alandonovan
